article.title: Topological critical slowing down: seven variations on a toy model

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of relationship is observed between the autocorrelation time of the topological susceptibility and the inverse lattice spacing for the Metropolis update algorithm?
What is the significant advantage of using the "tailor method" for updating the configurations in this study?
choices: It reduces the computational cost of each update step.
It allows for simulations at non-zero values of the theta parameter.
It completely eliminates the topological slowing down problem.
It improves the accuracy of the topological susceptibility calculation.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of the slab method, what is the relationship between the autocorrelation time of the slab topological susceptibility (Xs) and the size of the slab (x)?
choices: Smaller slabs exhibit shorter autocorrelation times.
The autocorrelation time is independent of the slab size.
Larger slabs exhibit shorter autocorrelation times.
The relationship is non-trivial and depends on the specific model parameters.

multiple_choice_question.text: For the non-interacting quantum particle model discussed in the article, what happens to the values of the topological susceptibility (χ) and the higher-order coefficients (b2n) in the high-temperature limit (β << 1)?
choices: χ approaches 0 and b2n approach non-zero constants.
χ approaches 1 and b2n approach non-zero constants.
χ approaches 0 and b2n approach values consistent with a Gaussian distribution.
